qas.question: What office was held by Fiame Mata'afa Faumuina Mulinu'u II?
What was the term of office for Samoa's first joint heads of state?
What year did the first of the two heads of state die?
Who was the head of state in Samoa in 2006?
Before becoming a de facto parliamentary republic, what form of government did Samoa have?
When did Fiame Mata'afa Faumuina Mulinu'u II die?
When Mulinu'u II died in 1963 who was left as sole head of state?
Before it was a de facto parlimentary republic, what type of government did Tamasese have?
For how long of a term was Malietoa Tanumafili II elected in 2007?
What happened when Malietoa Tanumafili II ran again in 2012?

context: Fiame Mata'afa Faumuina Mulinu’u II, one of the four highest-ranking paramount chiefs in the country, became Samoa's first <a0_0>Prime Minister<a0_0/>. Two other paramount chiefs at the time of independence were appointed joint heads of state for <a1_0>life<a1_0/>. Tupua Tamasese Mea'ole died <b5_0>in <a2_0>1963<b5_0/><a2_0/>, leaving <a3_0><b6_0>Malietoa Tanumafili II<b6_0/><a3_0/> sole head of state until his death on 11 May 2007, upon which Samoa changed from a <a4_0><b7_0>constitutional monarchy<b7_0/><a4_0/> to a parliamentary republic de facto. The next Head of State, Tuiatua Tupua Tamasese Efi, was elected by the legislature on 17 June 2007 for <b8_0>a fixed five-year term<b8_0/>, and <b9_0>was re-elected unopposed<b9_0/> in July 2012.
